intro: Odontosoria retusa, commonly known as the broad-leafed holly fern, is a species of fern native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its large, leathery, evergreen fronds. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte or on rocky surfaces, thriving in humid environments. Its fronds are usually bipinnate, with closely spaced, lance-shaped pinnae. Odontosoria retusa is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ability to tolerate a range of growing conditions.
